strings.Value: "I don't need your money!"
"You set me up! Now Linxia thinks we're accomplices!"
"Linxia was right about you. You belong on the rack!"
"Get out of my {mf|barony|barony|kingdom|kingdom} at once! — And don't let me catch you around here again!"
[Attack] "Death to the traitor!"
"Explain yourself then. I'm listening."
"Tell me once again about your deal with Mammon."
"Remind me — how did you make a pact with Mammon?"
"I've heard enough."
"What was the point of your pact with Mammon?"
"So, this means you want to become a king?"
"I'll take your deal."
"I don't care to help you. You're on your own."
"What amount of 'gratitude' can I expect?"

{n}{d|Darven}Darven{/d} turns to you and graces you with a shining smile.{/n} "I thank you for your help! Without you, I'd never have been able to deal with this fanatic. I hope you'll forgive me for the little show I took the liberty of putting on? After all, the results weren't bad, wouldn't you agree?"
"But it's yours." {n}Darven shrugs dismissively.{/n} "Give it to the poor, throw it away, or dump it in the river if you really can't be bothered."
"I regret if I've caused you any discomfort. I hope that the sound of golden coins jingling in your purse will help you forget this unfortunate episode."
{n}Darven sighs.{/n} "Things are unfolding in a most regrettable way. I should have offered {mf|him|her} more money…"
"Anyhow, it seems I owe you an explanation. — Again! That's beginning to become a habit! Ah, but before I forget, please accept this modest reward. You've earned every bit of it."

{n}Darven laughs in reply, but his eyes glint with caution.{/n} "The rack has been waiting for me for a long time. Sadly, I'm just too busy to waste my time on it. Besides, to tell you the truth, the rack is not my type of a date."

{n}Then, all of a sudden, Darven's voice grows serious.{/n} "If by any chance you decide to... facilitate my meeting with this missus — then you'll fail. I'll escape again. So let's just talk instead, without threats. Like civilized people."

"You do remember the whole story I told you earlier, right? About the duel with the {g|Cheliax}Chelish{/g} noble and the rebellion which followed his death? You see, that whole story has one little additional piece."

"Well, not so little, to be precise." {n}Darven grins.{/n} "His name is {g|Mammon}Mammon{/g}, and he's one of the Archdevils — 'the Ardent Prince', or so I've been told. He's made a pact with me, and I'm having trouble upholding my side of the bargain. — And his patience is growing thinner by the day."

"That {g|Cheliax}Chelish{/g} noble had a pact with {g|Mammon}Mammon{/g} too — which I expect is commonplace for the Chelish nobility. And the noble was in no hurry to fulfill his end of the deal, either. By killing him, I earned Mammon's gratitude, and he offered me a similar pact. A handsome sum of gold, and my cherished dream come true — that's what he promised. So how could I say no?"
"With pleasure!"
"So what do you say? Will you accept my offer?"

"I'm to become a king. No more, no less." {n}Darven grins, but this time his grin is joyless.{/n} "The subjects of my kingdom are supposed to worship {g|Mammon}Mammon{/g} as their official deity, and pay taxes to his temples."

"It's not so difficult a task, I suppose — especially if you have enough money. The only problem is Linxia. The moment I lay my kingdom's first cornerstone, I'll become an easy target. She'll instantly find me and promptly introduce me to all her torture devices."

"Oh, yes. It was my dream ever since I was sailing the {g|Inner Sea}Inner Sea{/g} as a part of the {g|Taldor}Taldorian{/g} merchant fleet. I even came up with a name for my kingdom — Brineheart. Ah, fond memories of those careless times, when I had neither crazy zealots nor offended Archdevil chasing me."

"However, I fear that soon I'll have to take the risk and establish my kingdom nevertheless. {g|Mammon}Mammon{/g} is growing restless. And in the end I'd rather risk facing Linxia than challenge him."

{n}Darven's habitual grin grows sad.{/n} "Unfortunately, you can't just retreat from all this. I have an obligation to establish a kingdom, so that is what I must do. I have nowhere to run. After I make my whereabouts known, Linxia will come for me. This is inevitable."
"The only open question is — what role will you play in our confrontation. I suppose all I can do about that is to wait and see. Until then — farewell."

"Excellent! In that case I'll establish my capital immediately. It will be a thriving trading hub, and its king will count himself in your debt. You won't be disappointed, you have my word on that. And I always keep my promises."
"I hope same can be said about you." {n}Darven smiles disarmingly.{/n}

"My finances are growing thin. I'm afraid I can't afford to offer you more than 10000 gold coins." {n}Darven's smile looks guilty.{/n} "But in addition, I offer good neighborly relations and common trade routes established between our two countries."
{n}Valerie folds her hands across her chest.{/n} "I cannot say which is worse — the lies and manipulation, or the sincere belief that the righteous wrath they caused can be bought off!"
"You shouldn't swing your purse around like that, handsome. What's keeping us from just taking you out first in the name of good and just robbing you? It'd be a bitter misunderstanding, indeed!"
"Such a beautiful story! And the name! It reminds me of my favorite pirate books! Oh, so many stories are swarming in my head..."

"Considering the questionable motives of honorable Darven, here, I would typically advise you to decline. But then, considering the personality of his adversary, I would recommend you agree! No organization in the world does more harm than the {g|Order of the Rack}Order of the Rack{/g}. And I'm not even saying this just because they've targeted my treatises for years..."
{n}Octavia laughs musically.{/n} "How romantic! I would be curious to see Brineheart, if you're ever lucky enough to turn it from dream into reality..."
"Give them to me. Nok-Nok knows what do with them. No tell you — don't ask."
